THEY SAVE LOVE IS BLIND, BUT BELIEVE ME -- LOVE IS INSANE.
Goodman, Diana. Seven weeks.
I don't feel like myself. I mean, I don't feel anything.
Hmpf. Patient stable.
Diana? This way, please.
Yeah...

I said welcome. Have a seat. It's nice to meet you.
Let's get it on now, baby...
Excuse me, what?
I said, let's get started. Are you... nervous, Diana?
I am, a little. A bit out of breath. Tingly, actually. now you go.
Well, let's start by getting to know each other a bit. Psychotherapy and medication work best in tandem, but we can try the first alone, and see how far we get. Why don't you tell me --
Bay-bee... what's your history? Where'd you go and who'd you see? Yeah...
Um. my history? Well -- I was diagnosed bipolar, um wow, sixteen years ago? But it turned out bipolar didn't totally cover it.
Often the best we can do is put names on collections of symptoms. It's possible bipolar has more in common with schizophrenia than depression.
When I was young, my mother called me "high-spirited". She would know. She was so high-spirited they banned her from the PTA.

I never know what to say when I have to go over all this. It starts to sound like some story I tell that's about some other person entirely.
Why don't you tell me about the last time you truly felt happy. (beat) Were you happy when you got married?
I thought I was.
There's a difference between being happy and just thinking you're happy?
Most people who think they're happy just haven't thought about it enough. Most people who think they're happy are actually just stupid.
I see. were you happy when your son was born?
My son?
Tell me about him.
About my son?
Why is he still around? Who is he? What is he?
I AM WHAT YOU WANT ME TO BE, / AND I'M YOUR WORST FEAR -- YOU'LL FIND IT IN ME. / COME CLOSER... / COME CLOSER...

My son?

About my son?
Why is he still around? Who is he? What is he?
I am what you want me to be, / And I'm your worst fear -- You'll find it in me. / Come closer... / Come closer...

I am more than memory -- / I am what might be, I am myster. / You know me -- / So show me. / When I appear it's / not so clear if / I'm a simple spirit or I'm flesh and blood.. / But I'm alive / I'm alive / I am so alive, / and I feed on the fear that's behing your eyes. / And I need you / to need me / it's no surprise -- / I'm alive... so alive... WALK WITH ME... / WALK WITH ME.

Stairs!

Di, you come home from these sessions in tears. Is this helping, or...? Di? Di?

HE'S NOT HERE... / HE'S NOT HERE... / LOVE, I KNOW YOU KNOW.

CATCH ME I'M FALLING FOR GOOD.

SHE'S NOT THERE... / SHE'S NOT THERE... / SHE'S NOT THERE...
MAKE UP YOUR MIND YOU WANT CLARITY: / TAKE WHAT YOU KNOW AND THEN MAKE IT MAKE SENSE. / JUST FACE WHAT YOU EFAR, / AND SOON IT COMES CLEAR / THE VISIONS ARE JUST YOUR DEFENSE.

MAKE UP YOUR MIND YOU CAN LIVE AT LAST / MAKE UP YOUR MIND TO BE FULLY ALIVE. / EMBRACE WHAT'S INSIDE, REPLCACE WHAT HAS DIED / THEN MAKE UP YOUR MIND YOU'LL SURVIVE.
CATCH ME I'M FALLING...

lines.line: They told me that the wiring / was somehow all misfiring / and screwing up the signals in my brain / and then they told me chemistry, / the juice, and not the circuitry / was mixing up and making me insane.
